ext_description.p: A Layout_macro_definition_terminal_to_usage_terminal_assignment is the association between the and one of several fabricated features. The purpose for this assignment is to link the product data in the macro definition to the floor planning usage view to support a recursive definition. The Layout_macro_definition_terminal_to_usage_terminal_assignment shall be referenced by one .
ext_description.note: In a recursive definition, both a macro definition and the macro interface declaration that is the are archived together, with this relationship populated as necessary to provide linkages between the fabricated features in the macro definition and the features in the planning view. Without this linkage populated, there is no way to traverse the recursive definition so as to successfully resolve the terminals at each level of recursion.
This facility is used to support transport of CAD data where geometric subroutines that include layer data and terminal data are defined.

A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template is a type of . A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template is part of a recursive definition or a geometric subroutine. A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template provides a layout shape and a set of terminal definitions for floor planning and layout purposes. The application compiler will replace the layout shape provided by this application object with the detailed definition specified by the
referenced by the macro_definition attribute.
ext_description.note:
An occurrence of this object is a
that is instantiated during floor planning layout during the design process for the interconnect substrate.
The shape of the Layout_macro_floor_plan_template should encompass the shape of the macro definition.
